meanings.definition: A person who hoards things, especially money or valuables.
meanings.sent1: My neighbor is a hoarder and has stacks of newspapers from years ago.
meanings.sent2: The hoarder kept every single coin they ever received.
meanings.sent3: The hoarder's house was so full of stuff, they couldn't find their way to the kitchen!
meanings.sent4: She was a hoarder of memories, keeping every ticket stub and photo from her travels.
meanings.sent5: The hoarder's collection of antique dolls was both impressive and slightly creepy.

meanings.definition: To accumulate and store a large amount of something.
meanings.sent1: I tend to hoard snacks in my desk drawer for when I get hungry.
meanings.sent2: She would hoard all the good ideas for herself and never share with the team.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel would hoard nuts in its burrow, preparing for the winter ahead.
meanings.sent4: He would hoard compliments, saving them for a rainy day when he needed a boost.
meanings.sent5: The dragon hoarded gold in its cave, protecting it fiercely from intruders.
